start.text:
The morning fog rolls across Golden Gate Park as you arrive at the Flower Piano installation. As a member of the Golden State Valkyries' secret detective unit, you've been called to investigate a shocking crime: someone has stolen the grand piano from the center of the flower garden!

You are Detective Veronica Burton, and your partners Detective Laeticia Amihere and Detective Carla Leite are already examining the scene. The A.C.E.S. (Anti-California Evil Society) has left their calling card - a black envelope with their twisted logo.
start.imageAlt: Empty piano platform in Golden Gate Park with fog rolling through the gardens

choices.text: Examine the crime scene for clues
Interview the park groundskeeper who discovered the theft
Check the A.C.E.S. calling card for hidden messages

examine_scene.text:
You kneel down where the piano once stood. The ground shows deep impressions from the piano legs, and there are fresh tire tracks leading toward the park's service road. Laeticia points to some scattered sheet music caught in nearby bushes.

"Look at this, Veronica," she says, holding up a page. "This isn't just any music - it's 'California Dreamin'' with strange annotations in the margins."

choices.text: Follow the tire tracks to the service road
Analyze the annotated sheet music
Search for more evidence in the flower beds

interview_groundskeeper.text:
The groundskeeper, Miguel Santos, is visibly shaken. "I came in at 6 AM like always," he explains nervously. "The piano was just... gone! But I did see something strange last night when I was leaving. There was a van parked by the service entrance with some kind of musical note logo on the side."

Carla takes notes as Miguel continues, "And there were these people in black hoodies. One of them was humming something, but it sounded... wrong. Like they were humming a California song backwards."

choices.text: Ask about the van's license plate or other details
Investigate the service entrance area
Ask Miguel to hum what he heard

examine_card.text:
The A.C.E.S. calling card is made of thick black paper with their logo - a twisted version of the California bear, but with red eyes and musical notes for claws. On the back, there's a message written in what appears to be invisible ink that only shows up when you hold it up to the light.

The message reads: "The Golden State's melodies will be silenced. Find us where the city's heartbeat meets the bay, but only when the fog lifts at the thirteenth hour."

choices.text: Research locations where 'the city's heartbeat meets the bay'
Figure out what 'the thirteenth hour' means
Test the card for fingerprints or other forensic evidence

follow_tracks.text:
The tire tracks lead to a parking area near the park's service road. You notice the tracks are unusually wide - definitely from a large truck or van. Carla kneels down and points to something glinting in the gravel.

"Piano wire," she announces, holding up a broken strand. "And look at this oil stain - it's fresh. Whatever vehicle they used was leaking oil, which means we might be able to track it."

choices.text: Follow the oil trail out of the park
Take photos and call for a forensic team

analyze_music.text:
Laeticia spreads out the sheet music on a nearby bench. The annotations are in red ink and appear to be coordinate numbers, but they're disguised as musical notations. You recognize the pattern - it's a code the A.C.E.S. has used before.

"These aren't random," you realize. "They're GPS coordinates, but encoded. If I'm reading this right, they point to somewhere near the waterfront."

choices.text: Decode the coordinates and head to the location
Look for more coded sheet music in the area

search_flowers.text:
Searching through the colorful flower beds, you find something unexpected - a small digital recording device hidden among the marigolds. When you play it back, you hear the sound of the piano being moved, along with voices:

"Careful with that corner! The boss wants this delivered to the warehouse by midnight."
"Which warehouse?"
"The old one by Pier 39. Where we stored those 'borrowed' Golden Gate Bridge cables last month."

choices.text: Head immediately to Pier 39 to investigate
Research the warehouse and plan a careful approach

waterfront_location.text:
The decoded coordinates lead you to an abandoned warehouse near Pier 39. Through a grimy window, you can see the stolen grand piano in the center of a large room, surrounded by A.C.E.S. members in their signature black hoodies. They appear to be preparing for some kind of ceremony.

You count at least six suspects, and notice they've set up speakers around the piano. A banner reads: 'OPERATION SILENT CALIFORNIA - Phase 1 Complete.'

choices.text: Call for backup and plan a coordinated raid
Try to sneak in and gather more intelligence

pier_39.text:
Arriving at the warehouse district near Pier 39, you spot the stolen piano through a window of a large building. The A.C.E.S. members are clearly preparing for something big - they've connected the piano to electronic equipment and have speakers set up around it.

Just then, your phone buzzes with a text from an unknown number: 'Stop interfering with our California Silence Project, or the piano becomes the first of many cultural treasures to disappear forever.'

choices.text: Coordinate with your team to surround the building
Try to negotiate with A.C.E.S. to understand their plan

call_backup.text:
Within minutes, backup arrives - including several other members of the Valkyries' secret detective unit. Together, you coordinate a simultaneous entry from multiple points. The A.C.E.S. members are caught completely off-guard.

'You'll never stop our mission!' shouts their leader as Carla places him in handcuffs. 'California's cultural identity must be destroyed!' But it's too late - you've recovered the piano and arrested the entire cell.

choices.text: Interrogate the A.C.E.S. leader about future plans
Examine their equipment to understand their 'Silence Project'

surround_building.text:
Your team executes a perfect coordinated assault. Laeticia and Carla take the back entrance while you and backup officers enter from the front. The A.C.E.S. members surrender quickly when they realize they're outnumbered.

As you secure the scene, you discover their plan was even more sinister than you thought - they were planning to use the piano in a public 'anti-California' concert to demoralize the state's residents.

choices.text: Search for evidence of other planned thefts
Focus on safely returning the piano to Golden Gate Park

interrogate_leader.text:
In the interrogation room, the A.C.E.S. leader reveals their twisted plan: 'We were going to steal iconic California symbols one by one, starting with the piano, then the Golden Gate Bridge cables, even Hollywood sign letters. Our goal is to demoralize Californians and make them lose their state pride.'

You've not only solved this case but uncovered a much larger conspiracy. The Valkyries' detective unit will need to stay vigilant to protect California's cultural treasures.

choices.text: Set up a task force to monitor A.C.E.S. activities statewide

search_evidence.text:
Your search reveals detailed plans for stealing the Hollywood sign, various Golden Gate Bridge components, and even plans to 'borrow' a cable car. You've uncovered a massive conspiracy against California's cultural identity.

Thanks to your detective work, law enforcement across the state can now prepare to protect these treasures. The piano is safely returned to Golden Gate Park, where visitors can once again enjoy the beautiful Flower Piano installation.

choices.text: Celebrate your victory with the team

return_piano.text:
üèÜ CASE CLOSED üèÜ

As the piano is carefully restored to its place among the flowers, the first visitor of the day sits down and begins playing 'California Dreamin'' - but this time, it sounds exactly as it should. Your detective work has preserved a piece of California's cultural heart.
